violations.excerpt: name does not meet format requirements
package name similar to existing packages

discussion.author: goerz
discussion.text: `JenaAtomicCalculator` seems like the perfect package name of this

discussion.author: OpenJAC
discussion.text:
> `JenaAtomicCalculator` seems like the perfect package name of this

We have created the Julia package JAC, the Jena Atomic Calculator, for the last 7 years.  We like to keep this name JAC, please, since it has been used in more than 25 scientific publications and has more than 100 stars in github meanwhile.

discussion.author: goerz
discussion.text: Well, this is why you should register packages _before_ publishing papers. `JAC` is the epitome of what we _donâ€™t_ want for package names. But itâ€™s not up to me, youâ€™ll have to convince one of the registry maintainers. ðŸ˜•

discussion.author: goerz
discussion.text:
Closing in favor of https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/132032

Thank you for re-registering! This looks great!
